article_title: In the battle for the 'burbs, state House candidates forced to pitch voters on a smorgasbord of issues

article_metadata.description: Roz PetersonTwo years ago, when she first knocked on doors in the Twin Cities’ southern suburbs, Republican Roz Peterson knew what was on voters' minds. “It was gay marriage and the Vikings stadium,” she said, recalling the 2012 campaign as she sat in a Lakeville coffee shop last week.

og.description: Though their races could decide who controls the Minnesota House, suburban legislative candidates have encountered a consistent theme: Voters aren’t very interested in politics this time around.
og.title: In the battle for the 'burbs, state House candidates forced to pitch voters on a smorgasbord of issues

article_metadata.keywords: Metro Area,Capitol,Minneapolis,St. Paul,Twin Cities,Minnesota DFL,Minnesota GOP,Minnesota Legislature,Election 2014,Politics,Burnsville,Lakeville,Roz Peterson,Will Morgan
